summary: This document is a series of Bureau of Prisons administrative forms from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 10, 2019. It includes an official out-count sheet, inmate roster, and multiple count slips, recording inmate population counts and assignments. The significance lies in its date, as it is the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at this facility.

events.title: MCC New York Inmate Count and Roster
events.description: Administrative count of inmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, showing a total population of 758 inmates across various housing units. An inmate roster lists specific assignments, including several inmates with 'SUICIDE' watch designations.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The document is dated August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
An official out-count records a total inmate population of 758 at MCC New York on that date.
An inmate roster from the same date lists several inmates with operational category assignments of 'SUICIDE', indicating they were on suicide watch.
The documents are standard Bureau of Prisons administrative forms for tracking inmate counts and housing assignments.
No specific inmate names (including Epstein's) are listed in the provided text excerpts; only unit codes, counts, and operational categories are visible.
